title: A worthy example of a vertuous wife who fed her father with her own milk, being condemned to be famished to death and after was pardoned by the Emperor. To the tune of Flying fame.
notes: Verse - "In Rome I read a noble man,".
Printer's name from STC; publication date suggested by STC.
In this edition, title has "own milk".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
